comments:
Take a list and place a chart in the detail section of the list. The dataset of the chart should take the current value of the list as parameter. This somehow doesn't work and you won't see a chart in the output.

For specifying the parameter I tried row["CUSTOMERNAME"] and row._outer["CUSTOMERNAME"]. 

I attached a simple example.

Cheers, michael

Created an attachment (id=41765)
no_chart_example

Very simple example that shows how the chart doesn't get rendered. The example is based on the CLASSIC Datasource.

This is due to the row_.outer syntax not working. The exception happens even 
before the chart code is reached, reassign to data team.

In this case row["CUSTOMERNUMBER"] should be used for specifying the parameter 
I save the attached example and change the value of dataset parameter binding to row["CUSTOMERNUMBER"].
Then the report can work.
Can you try row["CUSTOMERNUMBER"] in your environment and tell me the result?

I don't see a chart in the output. Neither with row._outer["CUSTOMERNUMBER"] nor with row["CUSTOMERNUMBER"].

(I'm using the RCP Designer. Just in case this is of importance)
I think row._outer should work in this case, this looks like a bug in the data layer. My understanding is that row._outer was introduced to avoid row name conflicts in the hierarchy of containers.

Dataset parameter binding is a special case. A dataset can't use the row of itselt as input parameter.
So using row["CUSTOMERNUMBER"] won't bring row name conflicts. 
I also test the report in RCP designer and the result is same.

The exception will still be thrown with row["CUSTOMERNUMBER"] ?

The another possible problem is the output format of chart. 
You can try to change the output format to "JPG" in firt page of chart edit.

Created an attachment (id=42128)
Jpeg as output format

The same example as in the first attachment but with the following changes:
- Use jpeg as output format
- row[CUSTOMERNUMBER] as parameter binding

I don't see a chart in the output even after changing the output format to jpg.
This is how i try to view the report:
1. Download RPC Designer version 2.1RC2
2. Copy prototype.js to plugins/org.eclipse.birt.report.viewer_version/birt/webcontent/birt/ajax/lib
3. Open report https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=42128
4. Click on File -> Preview in Web Viewer

My RPC version is 2.1RC3.
With your new report I can get the charts in the window of Preview Web Viewer.
Can you download the RPC version 2.1RC3 and try again?

It works with 2.1RC3 :-)
(Works with html and pdf output and for jpg and svg charts)
Thanks.
